title: [BUG] AngleSwapChainPanel SizeChanged event handler calls Invalidate before updating back buffer size
body:
**Description**

When resizing a desktop window filled with a SKGLView I noticed that the far right or bottom edge was sometimes white after the resize. In my OnPaintSurface method the e.BackendRenderTarget.Width/Height are the values from before the window resize. Looking at the implementation of AngleSwapChainPanel.OnSizeChanged() I don't see the back buffer size being updated before the call to Invalidate().

**Expected Behavior**

I would expect the back buffer resize to have happened before the call to OnPaintSurface().

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.68
- IDE:  VS2019
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - UWP:  16299
- Target Devices:
  - Desktop PC

**Screenshots**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1683504/61475818-7e17c980-a940-11e9-9f60-5f61bb54911a.png)

Note the white right and bottom edges. This is after the resize.
